Client

Class FTPAccessClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • Client.FTPAccessClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class FTPAccessClient
extends java.lang.Thread
    Class connects to the FTP server via the apache commons.
    Author:
    Ariel

    • Constructor Detail

      • FTPAccessClient

        public FTPAccessClient(java.lang.String serverAddress,
                       java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password)
        Initializes FTPAccessClient Object.

        The server-address has to either be a domain or a direct IP. Username and Password arent always needed

        Parameters:
        serverAddress - Address of the FTP server to connect to
        username - Username (not always used)
        password - Password (not always used)

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Tries to connect to the server.

        Returns false if connection is succesful and true if there was an error.

        Returns:
        boolean

      • login

        public java.lang.String login()
        Tries to log in.

        Tries to log into the server with credentials specified in the constructor. Returns "true" if the log in was succesful, "false" if the log in was rejected and "na" if the credentials arent specified.

        Returns:
        String

      • loginText

        public java.lang.String loginText(java.lang.String text)
        Returns a message according to the input.
        Parameters:
        text - Input is the output from login()
        Returns:
        String

      • getFTPFile

        private org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPFile[] getFTPFile()
        Gets all available files on the root of the server and returns them as a FTPFile array.
        Returns:
        FTPFile

      • getFS

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFS()
        Outputs filenames as ArrayList

        Gets FTPFile array from getFTPFile(), gets filenames from said array and puts it into the ArrayList.

        Returns:
        ArrayList

      • getFTPFileFromDir

        private org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPFile[] getFTPFileFromDir(java.lang.String dir)
        Gets all available files from a specific directory and returns them as a FTPFile array.
        Returns:
        FTPFile

      • getFSFromDir

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFSFromDir(java.lang.String directory)
        Outputs filenames as ArrayList

        Gets FTPFile array from getFTPFileFromDir(), gets filenames from said array and puts it into the ArrayList.

        Parameters:
        directory - The directory from which you want to know all available files
        Returns:
        ArrayList

      • convertToArrayList

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> convertToArrayList(org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPFile[] files)
        Converts a FTPFile Array into a String ArrayList
        Parameters:
        files - FTPFile Array from the FTP Server (all available files)
        Returns:
        ArrayList

      • delete

        public boolean delete(java.lang.String fileToDelete)
        Deletes a file on the server

        Tries to delete the specified file on the server. Returns true if it was succesful, false if it wasnt.

        Parameters:
        fileToDelete - File you want to delete on the server
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getFtp

        public org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPClient getFtp()

        Returns:
        FTPClient

      • getSERVER_ADDRESS

        public java.lang.String getSERVER_ADDRESS()

        Returns:
        String

      • fileExists

        public boolean fileExists(java.lang.String fn)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Checks if a file exists

        Tries to open an InputStream to the specified file. Return false if InputStream fails or if the server sends an error code (= file doesnt exist). Returns true if the method could initialize InputStream (= file does exist).

        Parameters:
        fn - Filename on the server
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If stream couldnt be initialized
